name: British Antarctic Survey De Havilland Canada Dash 7 Landing at Calgary Airport
description:
A special visitor! Every year, the British Antarctic Survey heads down to Antarctica for the southern summer, and with them comes a fleet of aircraft, including this very rare De Havilland Canada Dash 7! The BAS has a fleet of DHC-6 Twin Otters as well as this, their sole DHC-7. At the end of each Antarctic summer, the aircraft head back up north and most of them head to Calgary for maintenance, where the Twin Otters undergo maintenance at Calgary's Springbank Airport, and the Dash 7 goes to the International. For what purpose, I'm not entirely sure, but I've seen them unloading Twin Otter skis in past years. Glad to finally have filmed them! Enjoy this special arrival with ATC.

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFO
Operator: British Antarctic Survey 
Aircraft: De Havilland Canada DHC-7-110 Dash 7 (DHC7)
Flight Number: N/A
Aircraft Name: None
Livery: British Antarctic Survey Red
Engines: 4x Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A-50
Registration: VP-FBQ 
Route: Casper (CPR) - Calgary (YYC)
Callsign: Victor Papa Foxtrot Bravo Quebec
Runway used: 35R
Date filmed: April 4, 2018
Local time: 1230
